target_claim: Valley of Flowers National Park is a nature reserve situated in the West Himalaya in Uttarakhand, India. It spans over an area of 87.50 square kilometers (33.79 sq mi) and has no permanent human population. Being part of the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve, it serves as one of the last habitats for the endangered Asiatic black bear, snow leopard, and musk deer. Estimates indicate that approximately 500 endangered species thrive in this park.
